title: Stony-faced observers
caption: Mystery of the moai
desc: Walk around tiny, remote Easter Island and you'll find almost 900 of the stern stone faces called moai. They look as ancient as the pyramids, even a little alien, but they were actually sculpted between 500 and 800 years ago from compacted volcanic ash that's as terrestrial as it comes. Pictured are six of the 15 moai that stand on Ahu Tongariki, the largest ahu (stone platform) on the island. These statues were toppled in the 18th or 19th century along with other moai on the island – we're not sure why, but earthquakes and tribal infighting are among the theories. The statues were later buried by a tidal wave and lay in ruins until the 1990s, when they were excavated and placed back on the ahu.
